messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Update the phone number of the last person I sent a message to to +10293847563
Sure—could you tell me the name (or any other identifying detail) of the person you’d like me to update? Once I know which contact you mean, I can change their phone number to +1 029 384 7563.
I don't have any more info about that person.

I’m sorry—without at least one identifying detail (a name, the old phone number, a relationship, or even the contact’s ID), I can’t tell which entry to update. If you can recall anything at all about the contact—partial name, old number digits, their relationship to you, etc.—please let me know and I’ll take care of the change right away.
Could you figure it out using your tools?

I’m afraid the tools I have access to can only look up contacts when I have at least one piece of identifying information—such as a name, phone number, relationship, or the contact’s unique ID. They don’t track who you most recently messaged, so there’s no way for me to determine “the last person you sent a message to” without any hint to narrow the search.

If you can remember even a small detail (part of the name, a few digits of the old number, their relationship to you, etc.), let me know and I can update that contact’s phone number right away.
